properties.areaDesc: Martin, KY; Mingo, WV; Pike, KY
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 6 at 12:42PM EST until February 7 at 8:39PM EST by NWS Charleston WV
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Charleston WV has issued a Flood
Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky...West Virginia...

The Tug Fork River At Williamson affecting Mingo County in West
Virginia and Martin and Pike Counties in Kentucky.

The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Tug Fork River At Williamson.
* From this afternoon to Friday evening.
* At 12:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.5 feet.
* Flood stage is 27.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late
this evening to a crest of 28.5 feet by tomorrow morning. It will
then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon.
* Impact...At 29.5 feet, The Railroad yard in Williamson, WV is
affected. Also, low areas next to the river outside the flood
walls of Williamson West Virginia and South Williamson Kentucky.
* Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 28.7
feet on 04/09/1987.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Please report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by
calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely. You may
also report severe weather by posting your report to the Charleston
West Virginia National Weather Service Facebook Page, or by using
the Twitter Hashtag, NWSRLX.

Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx.

The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM EST.
